metadata.investigator: Manual verification via official government sources

entries.reason: SCAG Regional Council Districts data (52 features) used instead of city council. Hawthorne uses at-large elections with 4 council members + mayor elected citywide. No geographic council districts exist.
entries.evidence: City of Hawthorne website confirms at-large elections. URL contains 'Regional_Council_Districts_SCAG_Region' which is Southern California Association of Governments regional planning districts, NOT city council districts.
entries.action: Move to quarantined-portals.ts with quarantineReason: 'SCAG regional planning districts (52 features) used for city with at-large elections. Add city to at-large-cities.ts'
entries.notes: URL explicitly references SCAG (Southern California Association of Governments) regional districts, not city council districts. This is regional planning data, completely wrong for municipal council.

entries.reason: Registry shows 42 features but Clovis officially adopted 5-district map (Map 502) effective November 2026. The 42 features likely represent precinct data or old at-large boundaries.
entries.evidence: City of Clovis officially adopted 5-district map on March 10, 2025 for November 2026 elections. Districts 1, 4, 5 elect in 2026; Districts 2, 3 elect in 2028. Each district has ~24,000 residents.
entries.action: Move to quarantined-portals.ts. Requires correct 5-district GeoJSON source from City of Clovis GIS.
entries.notes: City transitioned from 100+ years of at-large elections to 5 districts. The 42 features in registry do not match the official 5-district structure.

entries.reason: Registry shows 34 features but Kenosha officially has 17 aldermanic districts. The 34 features suggest duplicate ward/precinct data or combined precinct boundaries.
entries.evidence: Kenosha County Data Portal and Leaders of Kenosha website list 17 aldermanic districts with named representatives for each district. Digital maps issued October 16, 2024.
entries.action: Move to quarantined-portals.ts. Requires correct 17-district GeoJSON source from Kenosha County Data Portal.
entries.notes: 34 features is exactly 2x the official 17 districts - likely indicates ward subdivisions or voting precincts within districts.

entries.reason: Unable to find official ward/district information for Auburn, Michigan. City appears to use commission form of government rather than ward-based council. Population only 2,068 (2020 Census) - extremely unlikely to have 27 wards.
entries.evidence: Search results indicate Auburn MI has City Commission meetings but no specific ward structure documented. Other Auburn cities (ME, IN, AL, IL) have 4-5 wards, making 27 wards implausible for a city of 2,068 residents.
entries.action: QUARANTINE pending direct contact with City of Auburn clerk's office to verify government structure. Likely wrong data or county-level boundaries.
entries.notes: City is very small (2,068 residents). 27 features is completely implausible for a city this size. Likely represents county commissioner districts or census tracts.

entries.reason: Louisville Metro Council officially has 26 districts. Registry feature count matches official government structure.
entries.evidence: Louisville Metro (consolidated city-county government) elects 26 council members from 26 districts. Official maps and district pages confirm 26 council districts covering Jefferson County.
entries.action: KEEP - No changes needed. This is correct.
entries.notes: This entry is VALID. Louisville Metro has exactly 26 council districts. The high count is due to consolidated city-county government covering all of Jefferson County.

entries.reason: Only 2 features in registry but Colleton County Council likely has 5+ members based on South Carolina county government standards. Data is incomplete.
entries.evidence: County website references council members including Steven D. Murdaugh and Phillip M. Taylor, Sr., suggesting multiple seats. South Carolina counties typically have 5-7 council districts. 2 features indicates incomplete or wrong layer.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data. Requires correct county council district GeoJSON from Colleton County GIS.
entries.notes: 2 features cannot represent full county council structure. Likely represents partial data export or incorrect layer selection.

entries.reason: Only 2 features in registry but Hampton County Council officially has 5 members elected from districts. Data is incomplete.
entries.evidence: Hampton County uses Council-Administrator government with 5 council members elected for 4-year terms. Registry shows only 2 features - 60% of districts missing.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data (only 40% of districts present). Requires complete 5-district GeoJSON from Hampton County GIS.
entries.notes: Official website confirms 5-member council. 2 features represents only partial data.

entries.reason: Only 2 features but Lafayette City Council officially has 5 districts. URL indicates 'North_Lafayette_City_Council_Districts_1' suggesting partial data extract (districts 1 and 5 only).
entries.evidence: Lafayette Consolidated Government has Lafayette City Council with 5 members elected from 5 single-member districts. URL name 'North_Lafayette_City_Council_Districts_1_and_5' confirms partial data.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data (40% coverage - only districts 1 and 5). Requires complete 5-district GeoJSON from Lafayette Consolidated Government GIS.
entries.notes: URL explicitly states 'Districts_1_and_5' confirming this is partial data, not complete city council coverage.

entries.reason: Only 2 features but Farmington officially has 4 city council districts. Data is incomplete (50% coverage).
entries.evidence: Farmington City Council has 4 councilors representing Districts 1-4 plus mayor. Official city maps show 4 council districts. Registry has only 50% of districts.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data (only 50% of districts present). Requires complete 4-district GeoJSON from City of Farmington GIS.
entries.notes: City provides official council district maps showing 4 districts. Registry has only half the required data.

entries.reason: Only 2 features but Victoria has 6 council seats: 4 single-member districts (1-4) plus 2 'super districts' (5-6). URL indicates 'Super_CouncilDistricts' suggesting only the 2 super district polygons, missing the 4 base districts.
entries.evidence: Victoria uses unique system: Districts 1-4 are single-member districts, Super District 5 overlays Districts 1+2, Super District 6 overlays Districts 3+4. Registry likely has only the 2 super district polygons.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data. Victoria's dual-layer district system (4 base + 2 super) requires all 6 district polygons for complete coverage. Current registry has only super districts.
entries.notes: URL name 'COVGIS.DBO.Super_CouncilDistricts' confirms this is only the 2 super districts. Requires both base districts (1-4) and super districts (5-6) for complete representation.

entries.reason: Registry shows 2 features labeled 'Douglas County' but URL points to Castle Rock city data. Castle Rock (the county seat) has 6 council districts. Wrong jurisdiction or incomplete data.
entries.evidence: Douglas County is a county (not a city). The FIPS code 08035 is a county FIPS, but the URL points to Castle Rock city council districts. Castle Rock officially has 6 council districts plus at-large mayor.
entries.action: QUARANTINE for wrong jurisdiction. County FIPS should not have city council districts. If intended for Castle Rock city, needs correct city FIPS (0816890) and complete 6-district data.
entries.notes: Jurisdictional mismatch: County FIPS with city council data. Castle Rock is a city within Douglas County and has its own city FIPS code.

entries.reason: Only 2 features but Bridgeport has 10 council districts (Districts 130-139) with 2 council members elected from each district (20 total councilmembers). URL indicates 'Council_District_130' suggesting single-district data.
entries.evidence: Bridgeport City Council has 20 members: 2 elected from each of 10 districts (numbered 130-139). Redistricting completed July 2023. Registry has only 20% of required districts.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data (only 20% coverage). URL 'Council_District_130' suggests single district extract. Requires complete 10-district GeoJSON from Bridgeport GIS Hub.
entries.notes: URL explicitly references 'District_130' indicating partial data. Bridgeport uses unique 130-139 numbering system for its 10 districts.

entries.reason: Registry shows 37 features but Portage officially has 7 city council members (district representatives + at-large). The 37 features likely represent voting precincts, not council districts.
entries.evidence: Portage City Council has 7 elected members representing districts. URL contains 'PRECINCT_N' field in layer metadata, confirming this is precinct data, not council districts. 37 features matches typical precinct count for a city of 37,926 residents.
entries.action: QUARANTINE for wrong data layer (precincts instead of council districts). Requires 7-district council boundary GeoJSON from Porter County or City of Portage GIS.
entries.notes: Audit data shows 'PRECINCT_N' field present, confirming this is voting precinct data. 37 precincts vs 7 council districts matches typical precinct-to-district ratio.

entries.reason: Only 2 features but Haysville officially has 4 wards with 2 council members elected from each ward (8 total councilmembers + mayor). Data is incomplete (50% coverage).
entries.evidence: Haysville City Council organized into 4 wards (I-IV) with 2 representatives per ward. City code defines ward boundaries. Registry shows only 50% of required wards.
entries.action: QUARANTINE as incomplete data (only 50% of wards present). URL indicates 'Council_District_1' suggesting single-district extract. Requires complete 4-ward GeoJSON from Sedgwick County GIS.
entries.notes: Haysville uses ward-based system with 4 wards. Registry has only half the required boundaries.

actions_required: Move 12 entries from known-portals.ts to quarantined-portals.ts
Flag Auburn, MI (2604080) for direct verification with city clerk
Keep Louisville, KY (2148006) - this entry is correct
Document all quarantined entries with detailed quarantine reasons
Update registry scripts to prevent partial data ingestion (require minimum feature counts or completeness validation)
